DOC.detailed_description: Patients FIGO stage I endometrial cancer patient FIGO stage I-IIA invasive cervical cancer undergo surgical management include lymphadenectomy . ↓ Injection radioisotope preoperative lymphoscintigraphy Tc99m either day day surgery Nuclear Medicine Department . ↓ Intraoperative lymphatic mapping blue dye gamma probe . ↓ Hysterectomy , Radical hysterectomy and/or radical trachelectomy pelvic lymphadenectomy .
DOC.criteria: Patients endometrial cancer diagnose endometrial biopsy dilatation curettage . Patients invasive cervical cancer diagnose cervical biopsy cone biopsy . Patients performance status 0 , 1 , 2 , 3 Gynecologic Oncology Group criterion ( Appendix ) . Patients stage I ~IIA invasive cervical cancer disease accord International Federation Gynecology Obstetrics ( FIGO ) clinical stag criterion ( Appendix ) . Patients clinical stage I endometrial cancer Patients undergo surgery include hysterectomy , radical hysterectomy and/or radical trachelectomy bilateral lymphadenectomy via laparotomy laparoscopy Patients sign approve informed consent . Patients history prior pelvic paraaortic lymphadenectomy . Patients stage IIBIV invasive cervical cancer FIGO criterion . Patients recurrent endometrial cervical cancer . Patients prior pelvic radiation . Any patient endometrial cervical cancer treat neoadjuvant chemotherapy radiation therapy . Patients performance score 4 Gynecologic Oncology Group criteria good surgical candidate ( Appendix ) . Patients grossly infected primary tumor . Patients know allergy triphenylethane compound .
